Text: RE BOC Gases ContractI need to make a couple of clarifications to Rahuls message First the proposed contract has a band for all zones It is not for Houston Second the fee they are unhappy with applies to energy as well as ancillaries They would like a fixed price adder defined for both What would you like us to charge for these adders We need to get an answer by midmorning They expect to decide by the end of this week who they will go to contract with Thanks Terrell Original Message From Seksaria Rahul Sent Tuesday November PM To Forney John M Gilbertsmith Doug Benke Terrell Subject BOC Gases Contract Importance High Terrel and I had a conference call with BOC this morning The call was very positive as they were still interested in talking with us They had a number of questions regarding the contract terms and seems like they want to sign something by week end I need clarification on a few issues that they raised We need to give them answers tommorow Proposed Contract terms Houston Zone MW per settlement Interval South Zone MW per settlement Interval North Zone MW per settlement Interval West Zone MW per settlement Interval BOC going to Balancing Energy charges outside the band Interruptibility BOC wanted to understand the mechanics Specifically they wanted to know how Enron would work with them to maximize curtailment opportunities They also wanted to know the quantity they could curtail eg If deal is MW can BOC curtail MW or just MW Also do they pay any penalty when they curtail etc Scheduled maintenance Can they sell contract power a week forward Is there any penalty for not being within the band during those hours BOC wants a fixed price quote for all Ancillaries and ERCOT Passthroughs However they want the ability to unwind this fixed price position should they feel they are better off with ERCOT market prices once the market becomes more transparent What is Enrons ability to provide such a service BOC doesnt like the charge in excess of Balancing Energy everytime they are outside the Quantity Band They said that they dont want to pay more when prices are high and they are outside the band They want a fixed fee instead of of BES price Given the bands we have placed in the contract BOC was outside the band a of the time in their Houston Zone Interval Load b of the time in their South Zone Interval Load c less than of the time in their North Zone Interval Load d of the time in their South Zone Interval Load Regards Rahul Seksaria Enron Corp Smith Street Ste A Tel Fax

FW list of chargesOriginal Message From Benke Terrell Sent Wednesday October AM To Curry Mike Cc Jester Larry Duffy Matthew Subject RE list of charges Here are the invoices for TXU Reliant and CPL When you use the files refer to the READ ME worksheet first Choose the invoice that matches your customers characteristics These arent necessarily the final rates or the final rules for implementing them The PUCT is expected to issue updated rates within the next couple of weeks Furthermore there is the risk of legal challenges to the rates It is not a straightforward exercise to calculate these rates on a MWh basis Ken Farrar in the tariff group created a TD estimator model to do just this He intends to update it to include any changes to the rates and to reflect interruptibility tariffs I can show you how to use the file I have saved all of these documents in mElectricERCOT OrigAhn FolderTD Terrell Original Message From Curry Mike Sent Friday October AM To Benke Terrell Cc Jester Larry Duffy Matthew Subject list of charges Terrell Could you please get Larry Matthew and I a summary of the charges listed on the sample invoice I gave you before for large industrials in TXU Reliant and CPL on a MWh basis When we talk to customers I would like a reference sheet that we can refer to to know things like TD is approx xMWh etc Thanks Mike
